BiblioData.Title: TRANSFECTION MICROARRAYS
BiblioData.Abstract: A transfection method of introducing sample molecules into cells is provided, comprising: (a) using a substrate comprising at least one sample spot area which is surrounded by an hydrophobic area; (b) wherein sample molecules are applied to said at least one sample spot area, thereby placing said sample molecules in the discrete location of said sample spot area; (c) applying cells to be transfected onto the substrate and incubation under appropriate conditions for entry of the sample molecules into said cells; (d) whereby at least a portion of said sample molecules are introduced into said cells.

Claims.P: CLAIMS
1. A transfection method of introducing sample molecules into cells, comprising:
(a) using a substrate comprising at least one sample spot area which is surrounded by an hydrophobic area;
(b) wherein sample molecules are applied to said at least one sample spot area, thereby placing said sample molecules in the discrete location of said sample spot area;
(c) applying cells to be transfected onto the substrate under appropriate conditions for entry of the sample molecules into said cells;
(d) whereby at least a portion of said sample molecules are introduced into said cells.
2. Transfection method according to claim 1 , wherein said sample spot area is wettable by the sample molecules.
3. Transfection method according to claim 2, wherein said sample spot area has hydrophilic and/or oleophilic properties.
4. Transfection method according to one of the claims 1 to 3, wherein said hydrophobic area is hydrophobic and/ or oleophobic, preferably ultraphobic.
5. Transfection method according to claim 4, wherein said ultraphobic area depicts a contact angle in relation to water of at least 140[deg.], preferably at least 150[deg.].
6. Transfection method according to claims 4 or 5, wherein said ultraphobic area is nano-structured.

7. Transfection method according to at least one of the claims 4 to 6, wherein said ultraphobic area has a surface topography, where the topological frequency f of the individual Fourier components and their amplitudes a(f) expressed by the integral

8. Transfection method according to at least one of the claims 1 to 7, wherein said sample molecules are covalently or non-covalently bound to said sample spot areas.
9. Transfection method according to at least one of the claims 1 to 8, wherein said sample molecules are embedded in a matrix.
10. Transfection method according to at least one of the claims 1 to 9, wherein a transfection reagent is applied to the substrate or is mixed with the cells to be transfected.

14. Transfection method according to at least one of the claims 1 to 13, wherein at least two different kinds of sample molecules are applied to said at least one sample spot area.

15. Transfection method according to at least one of the claims 1 to 14, wherein said sample molecule is selected from the group consisting of nucleic acids, peptides, small molecules and is preferably an RNA molecule, more preferably a RNAi mediating compound or a siRNA molecule.
